Package com.lpoo.redstonetools.model.circuit

Class Circuit

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lpoo.redstonetools.model.tile.Tile
      • com.lpoo.redstonetools.model.circuit.Circuit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Model, java.io.Serializable
    public class Circuit
extends Tile
implements Model, java.io.Serializable

    Circuit model class

    Circuit is a group of tiles, all the interaction logic of the tiles is handled by the controller
    See Also:
    CircuitController, Serialized Form

      • Circuit

        public Circuit​(int width,
               int height,
               Position position)

      • Circuit

        public Circuit​(int width,
               int height)

        Circuit constructor

        The grid of tiles is filled with empty tiles It also sets the initial tick value The sources are initially empty
        Parameters:
        width - Width of the circuit
        height - Height of the circuit

      • isInBounds

        public boolean isInBounds​(Position position)

        Checks validity of a position

        Tests if the position given is inside the circuit
        Parameters:
        position - Position to be tested
        Returns:
        true if the position is inside the circuit, false otherwise

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile​(Position position)

        Gets the tile in the specified position of the circuit

        Gets the tile in the specified position of the circuit if the position is valid If the position isn't valid, it is returned a new empty tile
        Parameters:
        position - Position of the tile
        Returns:
        Tile in the position specified if valid, NullTile on invalid position
        See Also:
        isInBounds(Position), NullTile

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile​(int x,
                    int y)

        Gets the tile in the specified position of the circuit

        Wrapper of function getTile(Position) to accept two integer values instead of a Position object
        Parameters:
        x - Position on the horizontal axis
        y - Position on the vertical axis
        Returns:
        Tile in the position specified if valid, NullTile on invalid position
        See Also:
        getTile(Position)

      • safeRemoveTile

        private void safeRemoveTile​(Position position)

        Removes a tile from the sources

        Auxiliary function to guarantee the integrity of the source tiles
        Parameters:
        position - Position of the tile to be removed

      • addTile

        public boolean addTile​(Tile tile)

        Adds tile to the circuit

        Adds tile to the circuit if tile has a valid position To guarantee integrity it removes the previous tile from the sources if needed If the tile to be added is also a source, then it is added to the list of sources
        Parameters:
        tile - Tile to be added
        Returns:
        true if the tile was added, false otherwise
        See Also:
        safeRemoveTile(Position)

      • removeTile

        public void removeTile​(Position position)

        Removes tile from circuit

        Removing a tile from the circuit is switching the tile for a empty tile, this is adding a NullTile
        Parameters:
        position - Position of the tile to be removed
        See Also:
        NullTile, addTile(Tile)

      • getSurroundingPower

        public int getSurroundingPower​(Position position,
                               Side side)

        Get the power level received from a specific neighbour

        Self explanatory
        Parameters:
        position - Position of the tile to check surroundings
        side - Side of the tile
        Returns:
        Power received from the specific side

      • getSurroundingPower

        public int getSurroundingPower​(Position position)

        Get the power level received from the neighbours

        Gets the maximum power level received from the neighbour tiles

        position - Position of the tile to check surroundings
        Returns:
        Maximum power level in the neighbourhood

      • canTilesConnect

        public boolean canTilesConnect​(Position position,
                               Side side)

        Tests if tiles can connect

        A tile can connect to other if the side of contact of the tiles are output and input or vice-versa
        Parameters:
        position - Position of the tile
        side - Side of the neighbour to test with
        Returns:
        true if the tiles are connectable, false otherwise

      • getIO

        public Tile getIO​(Side side)

        Get IO tile in side specified

        If circuit doesn't have IO tile on the side the behaviour is defined by the methods used
        Parameters:
        side - Side where IO wanted is
        Returns:
        IO tile at the side specified
        See Also:
        getTile(Position)

      • updateOnIOInteract

        public boolean updateOnIOInteract​(Position position)

        Updates IO tile to circuit mapping on interaction

        Verifies if the IO tile can be updated, and updates it if possible
        Parameters:
        position - Position of the IO tile to update
        Returns:
        true if IO tile was updated, false otherwise

      • updateOnIORotation

        public boolean updateOnIORotation​(Position position,
                                  Side previous)

        Updates IO tile to circuit mapping on rotation

        Verifies if the IO tile can be updated, and updates it if possible
        Parameters:
        position - Position of the IO tile to update
        previous - IO side before rotation
        Returns:
        true if IO tile was updated, false otherwise

      • getPower

        public int getPower​(Side side)

        Get the power level emitted on the side specified

        Circuit power level emitted depends on the IO ports it has
        Specified by:
        getPower in class Tile
        Parameters:
        side - Side of the tile (circuit)
        Returns:
        IO port power level if it is an output port, minimum power otherwise

      • rotateLeft

        public boolean rotateLeft​(Circuit circuit)

        Rotates a tile to the left

        In a circuit tile it rotates the sides pointing to IO tiles
        Overrides:
        rotateLeft in class Tile
        Parameters:
        circuit - Circuit where rotation is taking place
        Returns:
        true

      • rotateRight

        In a circuit tile it rotates the sides pointing to IO tiles
        Overrides:
        rotateRight in class Tile
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true

      • isTickedTile

        public boolean isTickedTile()

        Checks if tile is a ticked of power

        A circuit has its update tick as well as it can have ticked tiles inside it, so it is a ticked tile
        Overrides:
        isTickedTile in class Tile
        Returns:
        true

      • nextTick

        public boolean nextTick()

        Increments the circuit tick

        All operations to be done on new ticks are handled by the circuit controller
        Overrides:
        nextTick in class Tile
        Returns:
        true
        See Also:
        CircuitController, Tile.isTickedTile()

      • acceptsPower

        public boolean acceptsPower​(Side side)

        Checks if side specified is an input of power

        In a circuit it functions reversed, this is: - Having an output IO port means it accepts power from the outside via that IO port - Having an input IO port means it outputs power to the outside via that IO port
        Specified by:
        acceptsPower in class Tile
        Parameters:
        side - Side of the tile to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the side is an input, false otherwise

      • outputsPower

        public boolean outputsPower​(Side side)

        Checks if side specified is an output of power

        Specified by:
        outputsPower in class Tile
        Parameters:
        side - Side of the tile to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the side is an output, false otherwise

      • update

        public boolean update​(Circuit circuit,
                      int power,
                      Side side)

        Triggers a tile update

        Checks if inner circuit needs to be updated This update depends on whether the circuit has IO ports or not
        Overrides:
        update in class Tile
        Parameters:
        circuit - Outer circuit where updates are taking place
        power - Power received on the update
        side - Side from which inner circuit received an update
        Returns:
        true if inner circuit was updated, false otherwise

        public boolean onChange​(Circuit circuit,
                        int power,
                        Side side)

        Updates the tile

        Overrides:
        onChange in class Tile
        Parameters:
        circuit - Outer circuit where updates are taking place
        power - Power received on the update
        side - Side from which inner circuit received an update
        Returns:
        false
